Description: Summit Midstream Partners LLC, a North Dakota pipeline company that discharged 29 million gallons of fracking wastewater from its pipeline near Williston, North Dakota, over the course of nearly five months in 2014-2015, agreed to pay $35 million to resolve civil and criminal charges.

The pipeline company responsible for the discharge of 29 million gallons of oil-contaminated "produced water,"a waste product of hydraulic fracturing, was sentenced to pay a $15 million criminal fine and serve a three year period of probation.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
